info.text: The default category for questions shared in context '6.2 The Hyperbolic Functions'.

questiontext.text:
Even and Odd Functions Jevne og odde funksjoner

Constructing even and odd functions Konstruere jevn og odde funksjoner

A given function \(f(x)\) can always be split into two parts, one of which is even and one of which is odd. To do this write \(f(x)\) as \(\dfrac{1}{2}[f(x)+f(x)]\) and then simply add and subtract \(\dfrac{1}{2}f(-x)\) to this to give \[\qquad f(x)=\dfrac{1}{2}[f(x)+f(-x)]+\dfrac{1}{2}[f(x)-f(-x)].\] The term \(\dfrac{1}{2}[f(x)+f(-x)]\) is even because when \(x\) is replaced by \(-x\) we have \(\dfrac{1}{2}[f(-x)+f(x)]\) which is the same as the original. However, the term \(\dfrac{1}{2}[f(x)-f(-x)]\) is odd since, on replacing \(x\) by \(-x\) we have \(\dfrac{1}{2}[f(-x)-f(x)]=-\dfrac{1}{2}[f(x)-f(-x)]\) which is the negative of the original.
 En gitt funksjon \(f(x) \) kan alltid deles i to deler, hvorav den ene er jevn og hvorav den andre er odd.For å gjøre dette skriv \(f(x) \) som \(\dfrac{1}{2}[f(x)+f(x)] \) og bare legg til og trekke \(\dfrac{1}{2} f(-x) \) til dette for å få \[\qquad f(x)=\dfrac{1}{2}[f(x)+f(-x)]+\dfrac{1}{2}[f(x)-f(-x)].\] Uttrykket \(\dfrac{1}{2}[f(x)+f(-x)]\) er jevn siden når \(x \) subsitueres med \(-x \) får vi \(\dfrac{1}{2}[f(-x)+f(x)] \) som er det samme som originalen. Imidlertid er uttrykket \(\dfrac{1}{2}[f(x)-f(-x)]\) odde siden en substitusjon av \(x\) med \(-x \) gir \(\dfrac{1}{2}[f(-x)-f(x)]=-\dfrac{1}{2}[f(x)-f(-x)]\) som er det negative til det opprinnelige.

Example Eksempel

Separate \(x^3+2^x\) into odd and even parts. Separer \(x^3+2^x\) til odde og jevne deler.

Solution Løsning

\[\begin{align*}f(x) &= x^3+2^x,\\ f(-x)&=-x^3+2^{-x}. \end{align*}\] \[\begin{align*}f(x) &= x^3+2^x,\\ f(-x)&=-x^3+2^{-x}. \end{align*}\]

Even part: \[\dfrac{1}{2} (f(x) + f(-x)) = \dfrac{1}{2}(x^3+2^x-x^3+2^{-x}) = \dfrac{1}{2}(2^x+2^{-x}).\] Jevn del: \[\dfrac{1}{2} (f(x) + f(-x)) = \dfrac{1}{2}(x^3+2^x-x^3+2^{-x}) = \dfrac{1}{2}(2^x+2^{-x}).\]

Odd part: \[\dfrac{1}{2} (f(x) - f(-x)) = \dfrac{1}{2}(x^3+2^x+x^3-2^{-x}) = \dfrac{1}{2}(2x^3+2^x-2^{-x}).\]
 Odde del: \[\dfrac{1}{2} (f(x) - f(-x)) = \dfrac{1}{2}(x^3+2^x+x^3-2^{-x}) = \dfrac{1}{2}(2x^3+2^x-2^{-x}).\]

The odd and even parts of the exponential function De odde og jevne delen til eksponentialfunksjon

Using the approach outlined above we see that the even part of \(e^x\) is \(\dfrac{1}{2}(e^x+e^{-x})\) and the odd part of \(e^x\) is \(\dfrac{1}{2}(e^x-e^{-x})\) We give these new functions special names: \(\cosh x\) and \(\sinh x\).  Ved å bruke tilnærmingen som er skissert ovenfor, ser vi at den jevn delen til \(e^x\) er \(\dfrac{1}{2}(e^x+e^{-x})\) Og den odde delen av \(e^x\) er \(\dfrac{1}{2}(e^x-e^{-x})\) Vi gir disse nye funksjonene spesielle navn: \(\cosh x\) og \(\sinh x\).

Key Point: Hyperbolic functions Nøkkelpunkt: Hyperbolske funksjoner

\[\cosh x \equiv \dfrac{1}{2}(e^x+e^{-x})\] \[\cosh x \equiv \dfrac{1}{2}(e^x+e^{-x})\]

\[\sinh x \equiv \dfrac{1}{2}(e^x-e^{-x})\]
 \[\sinh x \equiv \dfrac{1}{2}(e^x-e^{-x})\]


These two functions, when added and subtracted, give \[\begin{align*} \cosh x+\sinh x &\equiv e^x, \\ \cosh x-\sinh x &\equiv e^{-x}.\end{align*}\] The graphs of \(\cosh x\) and \(\sinh x\) are shown in the below figure. Disse to funksjonene, når addert og subtrahert, gir \[\begin{align*} \cosh x+\sinh x &\equiv e^x, \\ \cosh x-\sinh x &\equiv e^{-x}.\end{align*}\] Grafen til \(\cosh x\) og \(\sinh x\) er vist i figuren nedenfor.

Figure: \(\sinh x\) and \(\cosh x\)
 Figur: \(\sinh x\) og \(\cosh x\)

Note that \(\cosh x>0\) for all values of \(x\) and that \(\sinh x\) is zero only when \(x=0\).
 Merk at \(\cosh x>0\) For alle verdier av \(x\) og at \(\sinh x\) bare er null når \(x=0\) .

Hyperbolic Identities Hyperbolske identiteter

The hyperbolic functions \(\cosh x\) and \(\sinh x\) satisfy similar (but not exactly equivalent) identities to those satisfied by \(\cos x\) and \(\sin x\). We note first some basic notation similar to that employed with trigonometric functions: \(\cosh^nx\) means \((\cosh x)^n\), \(\sinh^nx\) means \((\sinh x)^n\) for \(n\ne -1\).  De hyperbolske funksjonene \(\cosh x\) og \(\sinh x\) tilfredsstiller lignende (men ikke akkurat tilsvarende) identiteter som de fylt av \(\cos x\) og \(\sin x\). Vi noterer først noen grunnleggende notasjoner som ligner på den brukt med trigonometriske funksjoner: \(\cosh^nx\)  betyr \((\cosh x)^n\), \(\sinh^nx\)  betyr \((\sinh x)^n\) for \(n\ne -1\). 

In the special case that \(n=-1\) we do not use \(\cosh^{-1}x\) and \(\sinh^{-1}x\) to mean the reciprocals of the expressions. The notation \(\cosh^{-1}x\) and \(\sinh^{-1}x\) is reserved for the inverse functions of \(\cosh x\) and \(\sinh x\) respectively. I det spesielle tilfellet \(n=-1\) bruker vi ikke \(\cosh^{-1}x\) og \(\sinh^{-1}x\) til å symbolere det resiproke til uttrykkene. Notasjonen \(\cosh^{-1}x\) og \(\sinh^{-1}x\) er de inverse funksjonene til \(\cosh x\) og \(\sinh x\) henholdsvis.

Key Point: Nøkkelpunkt:

The fundamental identity relating hyperbolic functions is: Den fundamentale identiteten som relaterer hyperbolske funksjoner er:

\(\rm cosh^2 x - \sinh^2 x \equiv 1\)

This is the hyperbolic function equivalent of the trigonometric identity: \( \cos^2x + \sin^2 x \equiv 1 \) Dette er de hyperbolske funksjonenes ekvivalent til den trigonometriske identiteten: \( \cos^2x + \sin^2 x \equiv 1 \)

Key Point Nøkkelpunkt

The fundamental identity relating hyperbolic functions is:\[\cosh^2x - \sinh^2x \equiv 1.\] This is the hyperbolic function equivalence of the trigonometric identity: \(\cos^2x + \sin^2x \equiv 1\). Den fundamentale identiteten som relaterer hyperbolske funksjoner er: \[\cosh^2x - \sinh^2x \equiv 1.\] Dette er det hyperbolske ekvivalente til den trigonometriske identiteten: \(\cos^2x + \sin^2x \equiv 1\).



Key Point: More hyperbolic identities Nøkkelpunkt: Flere hyperbolske identiteter

\[\begin{align*} \cosh(x+y) &\equiv \cosh x \cosh y+\sinh x \sinh y \\ \sinh(x+y) &\equiv \sinh x \cosh y+\cosh x\sinh y \\ \sinh2x &\equiv 2\sinh x \cosh x \\ \cosh2x &\equiv \cosh^2x+\sinh^2x \equiv 2\cosh^2x-1 \equiv 1+2\sinh^2x \end{align*} \]

Related Hyperbolic Functions Relaterte hyperbolske funksjoner

Given the trigonometric functions \(\cos x,\sin x\) related functions can be defined; \(\tan x, \sec x, \rm cosec\) \(x\) through the relations: \(\tan x \equiv\dfrac{\sin x}{\cos x}\qquad \sec x\equiv\dfrac{1}{\cos x}\qquad{\rm cosec}\ x\equiv\dfrac{1}{\sin x}\qquad\cot x\equiv\dfrac{\cos x}{\sin x}\). Gitt de trigonometriske funksjonene \(\cos x,\sin x\) kan relaterte funksjoner \(\tan x, \sec x, \rm cosec\) \(x\) defineres gjennom relasjonen: \(\tan x \equiv\dfrac{\sin x}{\cos x}\qquad \sec x\equiv\dfrac{1}{\cos x}\qquad{\rm cosec}\ x\equiv\dfrac{1}{\sin x}\qquad\cot x\equiv\dfrac{\cos x}{\sin x}\).

In an analogous way, given \(\cosh x\) and \(\sinh x\) we can introduce hyperbolic functions. These functions are defined in the following Key Point. Lignende, gitt \(\cosh x\) og \(\sinh x\) kan vi introdusere hyperbolske funksjoner. Disse funksjonene er definert i følgende nøkkelpunkt.

Key Point: Further hyperbolic functions Nøkkelpunkt: Ytterligere hyperbolske funksjoner

\(\tanh x \equiv \dfrac{\sinh x}{\cosh x}\)

\(\rm sech\) \(x \equiv \dfrac{1}{\cosh x}\)

\(\rm cosech\) \(x \equiv \dfrac{1}{\sinh x}\)

\(\coth x \equiv \dfrac{\cosh x}{\sinh x}\)

Exercise 

Which of the following identities are correct?

generalfeedback.text:
Note the following.

\( \sinh(2x) = \sinh (x+x) \), so using the formula for \( \sinh(x+y) \) with \( y = x \) we obtain \( \sinh(2x) = 2 \sinh x \cosh x \).

\( \cosh(2x) = \cosh (x+x) \), so using the formula for \( \cosh(x+y) \) with \( y = x \) we obtain \( \cosh(2x) = \cosh^2 x + \sinh^ 2 x \).

Recall that \( \cosh^2 x - \sinh^2 x = 1 \) (previous key point) which implies \( \sinh^2 x = \cosh^2 x - 1 \), so combining with the formula for \(\cosh^2 x\) just obtained above we get \[ \cosh(2x) = \cosh^2 x + \sinh^ 2 x = \cosh^2 x + ( \cosh^2 x - 1) = 2 \cosh^2 x - 1.\]

Also, \( \cosh^2 x - \sinh^2 x = 1 \) (previous key point) implies \( \cosh^2 x = 1 + \sinh^2 x\), so combining with the formula for \(\cosh^2 x\) just obtained above we get \[ \cosh(2x) = \cosh^2 x + \sinh^ 2 x = (1+ \sinh^2 x) + \sinh^2 x = 1 + 2 \sinh^2 x.\]

To see that each of the other identities is incorrect, specify a particular value for \(x\) for which the identity is wrong. Also note that they are inconsistent with the correct identities that are proved above.

questiontext.text:
Exercise  Øving

Which of the following identities are correct? Hvilke av følgende identiteter er riktige?

generalfeedback.text:
Note the following Merk følgende

\( 1 - \tanh^2 x = 1 - \dfrac{\sinh^2 x}{\cosh^2 x} = \dfrac{\cosh^2 x - \sinh^2 x}{\cosh^2 x} = \dfrac{1}{\cosh^2 x} = \) \( \rm{sech}^2 \) \(x\).

To see that each of the other identities is incorrect, specify a particular value for \(x\) for which the identity is wrong. Also note that they are inconsistent with the above correct identities. For å se at hver av de andre identitetene er feil, spesifiser en bestemt verdi for \(x \) som gjør at identiteten er feil. Legg også merke til at de er i strid med de overnevnte riktige identitetene.

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

Separate the function \(f(x) = {@fx@}\) into odd and even parts. Separer funksjonen \(f(x) = {@fx@}\) til odde og jevne deler.

  1. First, find \(f(-x)\). Finn først \(f(-x)\).

    \(f(-x) = \) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

  2. Next, find the even part of Finn videre den jevne delen til \(f(x)\): [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] [[feedback:prt2]]

  3. Finally, find the odd part of Finn tilslutt dne odde delen til \(f(x)\): [[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]] [[feedback:prt3]]

generalfeedback.text:
We have the function Vi har funksjonen \(f(x) = {@fx@}.\)

\[ f(-x) = {@fnx@} \]

The even part is given by Den jevn delen er gitt ved \[ \frac{1}{2}[f(x) + f(-x)] = {@even1@} = {@x^n+ 1/2*(a^x+a^(-x))@}. \]

The odd part is given by Den odde delen er gitt ved \[ \frac{1}{2}[f(x) - f(-x)] = {@odd1@} = {@1/2*(a^(-x)-a^x)@}. \]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

questiontext.text:
Exercise  Øving

We derive a fundamental identity relating hyperbolic functions \(\cosh^2x-\sinh^2x \equiv \ ?\) Vi utleder en fundamental identitet som relaterer hyperbolske funksjoner \(\cosh^2x-\sinh^2x \equiv \ ?\)

  1. First, express \(\cosh^2x\) in terms of the exponential functions. Expand your answer. Uttrykk først \(\cosh^2x \) med eksponentielle funksjoner. Utvid eksponenten.

    \(\cosh^2x \equiv \) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

  2. Similarly, express \(\sinh^2x\) in terms of the exponential functions. Expand your answer. Tilsvarende uttrykk \(\sinh^2x \) med eksponentielle funksjoner. Utvid eksponenten.

    \(\sinh^2x \equiv \) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] [[feedback:prt2]]

  3. Finally determine \(\cosh^2x-\sinh^2x\) using the results from (a) and (b): bestem til slutt \(\cosh^2x-\sinh^2x\) ved hjelp av resultatene fra (a) og (b):

    \(\cosh^2x-\sinh^2x \equiv \) [[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]] [[feedback:prt3]]

Alternatively, we can prove the above identity by using the relations \(e^x \equiv \cosh x + \sinh x\) and \(e^{-x} \equiv \cosh x - \sinh x .\) Alternativt kan vi bevise identiteten ved å bruke relasjonene \(e^x \equiv \cosh x + \sinh x\) og \(e^{-x} \equiv \cosh x - \sinh x .\)

See solution/feedback if you cannot work this out on your own. Se løsning/tilbakemelding hvis du ikke kan ordne dette på egen hånd.

generalfeedback.text:
Here is a step by step calculation. Her er en trinnvis beregning.

\[ \begin{align*} \cosh^2x & \equiv \left( {@cosh@} \right)^2 \equiv \frac{1}{4}(e^x+e^{-x})^2 \\ & \equiv \frac{1}{4}[(e^x)^2+2e^xe^{-x}+(e^{-x})^2] \equiv \frac{1}{4}[e^{2x}+2e^{x-x}+e^{-2x}] \\ & \equiv {@cosh2@} .\end{align*} \]

\[ \begin{align*} \sinh^2x\ & \equiv \left( {@sinh@} \right)^2 \equiv \frac{1}{4}(e^x-e^{-x})^2 \\ & \equiv \frac{1}{4}[(e^x)^2-2e^xe^{-x}+(e^{-x})^2] \equiv \frac{1}{4}[e^{2x}-2e^{x-x}+e^{-2x}] \\ & \equiv  {@sinh2@}. \end{align*} \]

Alternatively, using \(e^x \equiv \cosh x + \sinh x\) and \(e^{-x} \equiv \cosh x - \sinh x \), we obtain \[1 \equiv e^x \cdot e^{-x} \equiv (\cosh x + \sinh x)(\cosh x - \sinh x) \equiv \cosh^2x - \sinh^2x \] as desired. Alternativt kan vi bruke \(e^x \equiv \cosh x + \sinh x\) og \(e^{-x} \equiv \cosh x - \sinh x \) til å få \[1 \equiv e^x \cdot e^{-x} \equiv (\cosh x + \sinh x)(\cosh x - \sinh x) \equiv \cosh^2x - \sinh^2x \] som ønsket.

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

questiontext.text:
Exercise  Øving

In this exercise, we show that \(\cosh(x+y) \equiv \cosh x \cosh y + \sinh x \sinh y\). I denne øvingen viser vi at \(\cosh(x+y) \equiv \cosh x \cosh y + \sinh x \sinh y\)

  1. First, express \(\cosh x \cosh y \) in terms of exponentials. Finn først \(\cosh x \cosh y \) som et uttrykk av eksponentialfunksjoner.

    \(\cosh x \cosh y \equiv  \) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

  2. Next, express \(\sinh x \sinh y \) in terms of exponentials. Uttrykk videre \(\sinh x \sinh y \) med eksponentialfunksjoner.

    \(\sinh x \sinh y  \equiv \) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] [[feedback:prt2]]

  3. Now, express \(\cosh x \cosh y + \sinh x \sinh y\) in terms of exponentials using (a) and (b), Bruk (a) og (b) til å uttrykke \(\cosh x \cosh y + \sinh x \sinh y\) med exponentialfunksjoner,

    \(\cosh x \cosh y + \sinh x \sinh y \equiv \) [[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]] [[feedback:prt3]]

    and realize that this equals \(\cosh(x+y)\) by definition. og innse at dette tilsvarer \(\cosh(x+y)\) per definisjon.

generalfeedback.text:
(a) By definition of hyperbolic functions, we have \( \cosh x \cosh y \equiv \left( {@coshx@} \right) \cdot \left( {@coshy@} \right) \equiv {@m1@} \). (a) Per definisjonen av hyperbolske funksjoner har vi \( \cosh x \cosh y \equiv \left( {@coshx@} \right) \cdot \left( {@coshy@} \right) \equiv {@m1@} \).

(b) Similarly, we have \( \sinh x \sinh y \equiv \left( {@sinhx@} \right) \cdot \left( {@sinhy@} \right) \equiv {@m2@} \). (b) Lignende har vi \( \sinh x \sinh y \equiv \left( {@sinhx@} \right) \cdot \left( {@sinhy@} \right) \equiv {@m2@} \).

(c) From (a) and (b), we deduce \[ \begin{align*} & \cosh x \cosh y + \sinh x \sinh y \\ & = {@m1@} + {@m2@} \\ & = {@m3@} \\ & = \cosh (x+y). \end{align*}\] (c) Fra (a) og (b) konkluderer vi at \[ \begin{align*} & \cosh x \cosh y + \sinh x \sinh y \\ & = {@m1@} + {@m2@} \\ & = {@m3@} \\ & = \cosh (x+y). \end{align*}\]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

questiontext.text:
Exercise  Øving

Let \( \sinh x = {@xx@} \), and \( \sinh y = {@yy@} \), calculate \(\cosh(x+y)\). La \( \sinh x = {@xx@} \), og \( \sinh y = {@yy@} \), kalkuler \(\cosh(x+y)\).

Note: Write down a formula for \( \cosh(x+y) \) in terms of \( \sinh x, \sinh y \), and only sub in numbers and use a calculator at the final step.  Merk: Skriv en formel for \(\cosh(x+y) \) som uttrykk av \( \sinh x, \sinh y \), og bare sett inn tall og bruk en kalkulator på det siste trinnet.

Round up your answer and enter \(4\) decimal places. If the answer has fewer than \(4\) decimal places, then enter zero(s) at the end. Avrund svaret ditt til \(4\) desimaler. Hvis svaret har færre enn \(4 \) desimaler, må du angi null(er) på slutten.

\( \cosh(x+y) = \) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Using the fundamental identity \( \cosh^2x - \sinh^2x = 1\), we get \(\cosh^2 x = 1 + \sinh^2 x\). Ved å bruke den fundamentale identiteten \( \cosh^2x - \sinh^2x = 1\), we get \(\cosh^2 x = 1 + \sinh^2 x\).

Similarly, \(\cosh^2 y = 1 + \sinh^2 y\). Tilsvarende er \(\cosh^2 y = 1 + \sinh^2 y\).

Next, take the (positive) square root to obtain \( \cosh x\), noting that \( \cosh x > 0 \) for all value of \(x\). Similar for \( \cosh y \).
 Ta videre den (positive) kvadratroten for å få \( \cosh x\), og merker at \( \cosh x > 0 \) for all verdi av \(x\). Det er lignende for \(\cosh y \).

Then use the formula \( \cosh(x+y) = \cosh x \cosh y + \sinh x \sinh y \), we obtain \[\begin{align*} \cosh(x+y) & = \cosh x \cosh y + \sinh x \sinh y \\ & = \sqrt{1 + \sinh^2 x} \cdot \sqrt{1 + \sinh^2 y} + \sinh x \sinh y \\ & = \sqrt{1 + ({@xx@})^2} \cdot \sqrt{1 +({@yy@})^2} + ({@xx@}) \cdot ({@yy@})\\ & = {@ta@} \text{ after rounding up.} \end{align*}\] Bruk deretter formelen \( \cosh(x+y) = \cosh x \cosh y + \sinh x \sinh y \), og finn \[\begin{align*} \cosh(x+y) & = \cosh x \cosh y + \sinh x \sinh y \\ & = \sqrt{1 + \sinh^2 x} \cdot \sqrt{1 + \sinh^2 y} + \sinh x \sinh y \\ & = \sqrt{1 + ({@xx@})^2} \cdot \sqrt{1 +({@yy@})^2} + ({@xx@}) \cdot ({@yy@})\\ & = {@ta@} \text{ etter avrunding.} \end{align*}\]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

questiontext.text:
Exercise 

In this exercise, we show that \(\sinh(x+y) \equiv \sinh x \cosh y + \cosh x \sinh y\).

  1. First, express \(\sinh x \cosh y \) in terms of exponentials.

    \(\sinh x \cosh y  \equiv \) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

  2. Next, express \(\cosh x \sinh y \) in terms of exponentials.

    \(\cosh x \sinh y  \equiv \) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]]

  3. Now, express \(\sinh x \cosh y + \cosh x \sinh y\) in terms of exponentials using (a) and (b),

    \(\sinh x \cosh y + \cosh x \sinh y \equiv \) [[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]]

    4. and realize that this equals \(\sinh(x+y)\) by definition.

generalfeedback.text:
(a) By definition of hyperbolic functions, we have \( \sinh x \cosh y \equiv \left( {@sinhx@} \right) \cdot \left( {@coshy@} \right) \equiv {@m1@} \).

(b) Similarly, we have \( \cosh x \sinh y \equiv \left( {@coshx@} \right) \cdot \left( {@sinhy@} \right) \equiv {@m2@} \).

(c) From (a) and (b), we deduce \[ \begin{align*} & \sinh x \cosh y + \cosh x \sinh y \\ & = {@m1@} + {@m2@} \\ & = {@m3@} \\ & = \sinh (x+y). \end{align*}\]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

name.text: 6.2.2.6 (not in quiz) Compute sinh(x+y) knowing sinhx, sinhy

questiontext.text:
Exercise 

Let \( \sinh x = {@xx@} \), and \( \sinh y = {@yy@} \), calculate \(\sinh(x+y)\).

Note: Write down a formula for \( \sinh(x+y) \) in terms of \( \sinh x, \sinh y \), and only sub in numbers and use a calculator at the final step. Round up your answer and enter 4 decimal places. If the answer has less than 4 decimal places, then enter zero(s) at the end.

\( \sinh(x+y) = \) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Using the fundamental identity \( \cosh^2x - \sinh^2x = 1\), we get \(\cosh^2 x = 1 + \sinh^2 x\). Similarly, \(\cosh^2 y = 1 + \sinh^2 y\).

Next, take the (positive) square root to obtain \( \cosh x\), noting that \( \cosh x > 0 \) for all value of \(x\). Similar for \( \cosh y \).

Then use the formula \( \sinh(x+y) = \sinh x \cosh y + \cosh x \sinh y \), we obtain \[\begin{align*} \sinh(x+y) & = \sinh x \cosh y + \cosh x \sinh y \\ & = \sinh x \cdot \sqrt{1 + \sinh^2 y} + \sqrt{1 + \sinh^2 x} \cdot \sinh y \\ & = ({@xx@}) \cdot \sqrt{1 + ({@yy@})^2} + \sqrt{1 +({@xx@})^2} \cdot ({@yy@}) \\ & = {@ta@} \text{ after rounding up.} \end{align*}\]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

questiontext.text:
Exercise  Øving

Given \(\tanh{@arg@} = {@tanh@} \). Compute \( \rm{sech}\) \( {@arg@} \). Round up and enter 4 decimal places. If the answer has less than 4 decimal places, then enter zero(s) at the end. Gitt \(\tanh{@arg@} = {@tanh@} \). Beregn \( \rm{sech}\) \( {@arg@} \). Rund opp til 4 desimaler. Hvis svaret har færre enn 4 desimaler, må du sette inn null(er) på slutten.

\( \rm{sech} \) \({@arg@} = \) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Use the identity \( \rm{sech}^2\)\({@arg@} = 1 - \tanh^2{@arg@}\) to calculate \(\rm{sech}^2\)\({@arg@}\), then take the (positive) square root to obtain \(\rm{sech}\) \({@arg@} \), noting that \(\rm{sech}\) \( {@arg@} = \frac{1}{\cosh{@arg@}} >0\) for all values of \({@arg@}\). Bruk identiteten \( \rm{sech}^2\)\({@arg@} = 1 - \tanh^2{@arg@}\) for å kalkulere \(\rm{sech}^2\)\({@arg@}\), og ta (den positive) kvadratroten for å få \(\rm{sech}\) \({@arg@} \). Merk at \(\rm{sech}\) \( {@arg@} = \frac{1}{\cosh{@arg@}} >0\) for alle verdier av \({@arg@}\).

\(\rm{sech}\) \({@arg@} = \sqrt{1 - \tanh^2{@arg@}} = \sqrt{1 - ({@tanh@})^2} ={@ta@}\) to four significant figures (or four decimal places in this case). \(\rm{sech}\) \({@arg@} = \sqrt{1 - \tanh^2{@arg@}} = \sqrt{1 - ({@tanh@})^2} ={@ta@}\) (eller fire desimaler i dette tilfellet).

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

name.text: 6.2.4.1 (not in quiz) Express sinh, cosh in terms of exp (exercise 1(a))

questiontext.text:
Exercise 

Express the following in terms of \(e^{{@aa@}{@xx@}}\) and \(e^{-{@aa@}{@xx@}}\).

\(  {@uu@} \sinh({@aa@}{@xx@}) + {@vv@} \cosh({@aa@}{@xx@}) = \) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

name.text: 6.2.4.2 Express sinh, cosh in terms of exp (exercise 1(b))

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

Express the following in terms of \(e^{{@aa@}{@xx@}}\) and \(e^{-{@aa@}{@xx@}}\). Uttrykk følgende med \(e^{{@aa@}{@xx@}}\) og \(e^{-{@aa@}{@xx@}}\).

\(  {@uu@} \sinh({@aa@}{@xx@}) - {@vv@} \cosh({@aa@}{@xx@}) = \) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

name.text: 6.2.4.3 Express exp in terms of sinh, cosh (exercise 2(a))

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

Express the following in terms of \(\sinh({@aa@}{@xx@})\) and \(\cosh({@aa@}{@xx@})\). Uttrykk følgende med \(\sinh({@aa@}{@xx@})\) og \(\cosh({@aa@}{@xx@})\).

\(  {@uu@} e^{{@aa@}{@xx@}} - {@vv@} e^{-{@aa@}{@xx@}} = \) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Using \(e^{{@aa@}{@xx@}} = \cosh {@aa@}{@xx@} + \sinh {@aa@}{@xx@} \) and \(e^{-{@aa@}{@xx@}} = \cosh {@aa@}{@xx@} - \sinh {@aa@}{@xx@} \), we get Med \(e^{{@aa@}{@xx@}} = \cosh {@aa@}{@xx@} + \sinh {@aa@}{@xx@} \) og \(e^{-{@aa@}{@xx@}} = \cosh {@aa@}{@xx@} - \sinh {@aa@}{@xx@} \) får vi

\[ \begin{align*} & {@uu@} e^{{@aa@}{@xx@}} - {@vv@} e^{-{@aa@}{@xx@}} \\ & = {@uu@}( \cosh {@aa@}{@xx@} + \sinh {@aa@}{@xx@} ) - {@vv@} (\cosh {@aa@}{@xx@} - \sinh {@aa@}{@xx@}) \ \\ & = {@ta@} \end{align*}\]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

name.text: 6.2.4.4 Express exp in terms of coth (exercise 2(b))

questiontext.text:
Exercise
 Øving

Express the following in terms of \(\coth({@aa@}{@xx@})\). Uttrykk følgende i form av \(\coth({@aa@}{@xx@})\).

\(  \dfrac{{@uu@} e^{{@aa@}{@xx@}}} {{@vv@} e^{{@aa@}{@xx@}} - {@vv@} e^{-{@aa@}{@xx@}}} = \) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

generalfeedback.text:
It will be worth keeping in mind that \(\coth(z)=\dfrac{\cosh(z)}{\sinh(z)}\). We start by rewriting the expression in terms of \(\sinh({@aa@}{@xx@})\) and \(\cosh({@aa@}{@xx@})\) as at least these are more like the expression we are targeting. For the numerator we use \[e^z=\cosh(z)+\sinh(z)\] while for denominator we can notice that this is already quite close to \(\sinh({@aa@}{@xx@})\) indeed \[ \sinh({@aa@}{@xx@})=\frac{e^{{@aa@}{@xx@}}-e^{-{@aa@}{@xx@}}}{2}.\] Det er verdt å huske at \(\coth(z)=\dfrac{\cosh(z)}{\sinh(z)}\). Vi starter med å omskrive uttrykket i form av \(\sinh({@aa@}{@xx@})\) og \(\cosh({@aa@}{@xx@})\) som er nærmere det vi er ute etter. For telleren bruker vi \[e^z=\cosh(z)+\sinh(z)\] mens for nevner kan vi merke at dette allerede er ganske nærme \(\sinh({@aa@}{@xx@})\) med \[ \sinh({@aa@}{@xx@})=\frac{e^{{@aa@}{@xx@}}-e^{-{@aa@}{@xx@}}}{2}.\]

Note that instead of spotting this we could just write each \(e^z=\cosh(z)+\sinh(z)\), there would be some cancelation after using the even / odd properties of \(\cosh(z)\) and \(\sinh(z)\). The result is of course the same. It's good exercise to confirm. Merk at i stedet for å oppdage dette kunne vi bare skrive hver \(e^z=\cosh(z)+\sinh(z)\), det ville være noen kansellering etter å ha brukt jevn/odde egenskapene til \(\cosh(z)\) og \(\sinh(z)\). Resultatet er selvfølgelig det samme, men det er god trening å bekrefte.

In any case, we can bring this together and simplify to see I alle fall kan vi bringe dette sammen og forenkle for å se at

\[\dfrac{{@uu@} e^{{@aa@}{@xx@}}} {{@vv@} e^{{@aa@}{@xx@}} - {@vv@} e^{-{@aa@}{@xx@}}} = \dfrac{{@uu@}(\cosh({@aa@}{@xx@}) + \sinh({@aa@}{@xx@}))}{{@2*vv@} \sinh({@aa@}{@xx@})} = \dfrac{{@uu@}}{{@2*vv@}} \cdot \frac{\cosh({@aa@}{@xx@})}{\sinh({@aa@}{@xx@})} + \dfrac{{@uu@}}{{@2*vv@}} = {@ta@}. \]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

name.text: 6.2.4.5 (not in quiz) Express exp in terms of sinh, cosh (exercise 2(c))

questiontext.text:
Exercise 

Express the following in terms of \(\sinh({@aa@}{@xx@})\) and \(\cosh(-{@aa@}{@xx@})\).

\(  {@uu@} e^{-{@aa@}{@xx@}} - {@vv@} e^{{@aa@}{@xx@}} = \) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

name.text: 6.2.4.6 Calculate tanh, cosech, sech (exercise 3) (NOT IN QUIZ)

questiontext.text:
Exercise

Using only the \(\cosh\) and \(\sinh\) keys on your calculator (or \(e^x\) key) find the values of the following. Round up and enter 4 decimal places. If the answer has less than 4 decimal places, then enter zero(s) at the end.

  1. \( \tanh {@aaa@} =\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

  2. \( \rm{cosech} \ {@bb@} =\) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]]

  3. \( \rm{sech} \ {@ccc@} =\) [[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]]

generalfeedback.text:
(a) Using \( \cosh\) and \(\sinh \) keys, \( \tanh {@aaa@} = \dfrac{\sinh {@aaa@}}{\cosh {@aaa@}} = {@ta1@} \)

Using \(e^x\) key, \( \tanh {@aaa@} = \dfrac{e^{{@aaa@}} - e^{-{@aaa@}}}{e^{{@aaa@}} + e^{-{@aaa@}}} = {@ta1@}\)

(b) Using \(\sinh \) key, \( \rm{cosech} \ {@bb@} = \dfrac{1}{\sinh {@bb@}} = {@ta2@}\)

Using \(e^x\) key, \( \rm{cosech} \ {@bb@} = \dfrac{1}{e^{{@bb@}} - e^{-{@bb@}}} = {@ta2@} \)

(c) Using \( \cosh\) key, \( \rm{sech} \ {@ccc@} = \dfrac{1}{\cosh {@ccc@}} = {@ta3@}\)

Using \(e^x\) key, \( \rm{sech} \ {@ccc@} = \dfrac{1}{e^{{@ccc@}} + e^{-{@ccc@}}} = {@ta3@} \)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.
